content.description: This routes has a bouldery start to get off the ground followed by a steep wall with technical climbing to a ledge. After the obvious crux section, there is fairly sustained 5.10 climbing to the anchors. Classic for the Tick Farm. This route is often top roped after ascending the easier Birthday Tick, which shares the same anchors.
content.location: First route where the trail meets the Tick Farm Wall.

climbs.name: Ticktastic
climbs.fa: Michael Moore, Tim Karst, Olin Martin

content.description: Technical climbing with thin top crux.
content.location: Middle of the Tick Farm. Shares anchors with No Dick Tick.

content.description: Delicate old school no-hands stand-up at top. Avoid going left before last bolt.

climbs.name: Tick On
climbs.fa: Tim Karst, Dave Jones, Kurt Krueger

content.description: Interesting and good route that passes over a tricky roof a third of the way up the climb. The route has an endurance factor--hang on.
content.location: This route is just to the right of Witness the Tickness. It is the first route to the east of the point where the trail meets the wall.

content.description: Tricky shelf move opening with fun climbing on big holds to the top.
Begins 30 feet from the left edge of the wall. Thin, reachy crux. No gimme. Finish at anchors on main ledge. Good approach pitch to Shere Khan and Tiger by the Tail.
content.location: Last route on the Tick Farm as your hiking up the trail to the west toward Big Science and Upper Tier sectors.

climbs.name: No Dick Tick
climbs.fa: Michael Moore, Kate Moore, Brett Klaassen Van Oorschot

content.description: Straight, clean line on big holds. Very popular route. Named by Kate Moore.
content.location: Middle of the Tick Farm Wall.

climbs.name: Jonesin' for a Tick
climbs.fa: Dave Jones, Tim Karst, Kurt Krueger

content.description: Steep climbing on big holds, snakes back and forth up the wall.
content.location: Just to the right of Tick On and shares the same anchors.

content.description: Fun climb. Finish at anchors on main ledge for the Tiger Wall. Good approach for Sabertooth.
content.location: Second to last climb on the Tick Farm as you are heading up the trial to the west.

content.description: Six-bolt route left of Witness on lower end of Tick Farm Wall. A few sneaky moves, with a strong 5.9 finish. Although not aesthetically pure as some other North Rim routes, Fantastick is a good warmup for 5.10 climbers and a challenge for 5.9ers. Be careful at the end!
This is a fun and popular route. A somewhat awkward start leads to steep climbing on good holds with an exciting finish.
content.location: This routes is just to the left of Witness the Tickness. It's the second route encountered walking east after the trail meets the the Tick Farm Wall.
